messages.content: What changes were made in the Update2 refactor of ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper?

The Update2 refactor changed lots of things to better integrate with ComfyUI. It allows using clip_vision and clip models with better memory usage. New example workflows were included, but old workflows need to be updated.
How much VRAM is required for sampling and decoding in the ToonCrafter support update of ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper?
For 512x320 resolution, the ToonCrafter support update requires slightly under 15GB VRAM for sampling and peaks at around 17GB during decoding.
What is the most memory hungry operation in the ToonCrafter update and what does it require for full quality results?
Decoding is the most memory hungry operation in the ToonCrafter update. It requires XFORMERS for full quality results.
How can the ToonCrafter model be used with the old Dynamicrafter I2V node and what are the trade-offs?
The ToonCrafter model can be used with the old Dynamicrafter I2V node, but the quality suffers a lot more while memory usage is halved, fitting under 8GB at best.
What is the purpose of the fp8 option in the ToonCrafter update?
The fp8 option can further reduce memory use by 1-2GB in the ToonCrafter update.
How can the ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper be installed?

The ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper can be installed either by using the manager to install from git, or by cloning the repo to custom_nodes and running 'pip install -r requirements.txt'. For portable installation, run the provided command in the ComfyUI_windows_portable folder.
What is the recommended way to reduce memory usage when using ComfyUI-DynamiCrafterWrapper?
It is recommended to use xformers to reduce memory usage when possible. It can be installed using the provided pip command, or with the portable command if using ComfyUI_windows_portable.
